snippet.title: Australia's trade surplus just missed by a mile
snippet.content:
Australia's trade surplus narrowed sharply in June.
According to data released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS), the surplus fell to $856 million in seasonally adjusted terms, missing expectations for a decrease to $1.8 billion.
May's trade surplus, previously reported at $2.471 billion, was revised down to $2.024 billion.
The ABS said that exports fell by 1% to $ billion to $31.779 billion.
On the other side of the ledger, imports rose by 2% to $30.923 billion.
